title.rendered: Alert about false job offer by WhatsApp – Noticieros Televisa

content.rendered:
In social networks there have been alerts about a false job offer circulating on WhatsApp. This offer would promise a job at Amazon with a salary of up to 80 thousand pesos, but in reality It is a fraud to commit crimes such as identity theft.

We recommend: How does the new way of stealing identity by WhatsApp operate?

Victims usually receive a message from an unknown contact with a job offer. The offer, which claims to come from Amazon, ensures that they are offered a vacancy for a position where they work only one hour a day.

As if that were not enough, they are promised a salary of up to 80 thousand pesos. The fake offer is accompanied by a link.

“We are an Amazon network marketing alliance. We are hiring a part time team as long as you have a smartphone. One hour a day. Monthly salary of 20,000 to 80,000 Mexican pesos”, reads these messages.

This is a type of scam known as phishing, where criminals pretend to be a service or company for the sole purpose of stealing victims’ personal information. Depending on the kind of information they get, from there Other crimes such as identity theft or extortion may occur.

This is not the first scam of this type recorded in the year. In April, a similar scam was reported, which also occurred on WhatsApp, where a scammer was posing as a suspected Amazon recruiter.

Faced with this kind of fraudulent messages, the recommendation of the Cyber ​​Police is delete the message and do not click on any links or material included in it. The suspicious number must also be blocked and reported within the same application.

Any possible crime of this nature You can report to the Cyber ​​Police of Mexico City on the telephone number 55 5242 5100, extension 5086. A complaint can also be sent to the email policia.cibernetica@ssc.cdmx.gob.mx.
